title: Magnetism compare B field for current slabs

content.question: Which of the following correctly compares the magnitude of the magnetic fields <math alttext="B sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="B sub 2" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>B</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </math>, and <math alttext="B sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math> near slabs <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, B sub 1 equals B sub 2, close parenthesis, is greater than B sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, B sub 2 equals B sub 3, close parenthesis, is greater than B sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="B sub 3 is greater than B sub 1, which is greater than B sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="B sub 3 is greater than B sub 2, which is greater than B sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="B sub 3 is greater than B sub 2, which is greater than B sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
